title: The Rolling Stones Make a Bid for Cross-Generational Appeal With Collaborations on Hackney Diamonds
description: The rock band, which formed in 1962, makes a bid for cross-generational appeal on its new album with Sydney Sweeney and Lady Gaga collaborations.

title: Pence Challenges GOP to Ditch Trump’s Populism for Reagan-Era Conservatism
description: In his most explicit rebuke of his former boss yet, Pence opened a new front in the 2024 race, one with strong echoes of 1976.

title: Breaking Down the Surprise Cameo at the End of Ahsoka Episode 4
description: What to know about Hayden Christensen's appearance as Anakin Skywalker in the new Star Wars series.

title: Prosecutors Seeking New Indictment for Hunter Biden by End of September
description: The exact charges the president’s son would face were not immediately clear.

title: Extreme Heat Forces Schools Across Northeastern U.S. To Close Early
description: Schools in Michigan, Maryland, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and Virginia cited inadequate air conditioning in cutting days short this week.

title: Biden Administration Blocks Oil and Gas Drilling in Alaska’s Arctic National Wildlife Refuge
description: The U.S. Interior Department canceled seven Trump-era oil and gas leases in Alaska's Arctic National Wildlife Refuge.

title: America Should Harvest a Trillion Gallons of Rainwater
description: As droughts heighten interest in costly and controversial water megaprojects, it’s time to scale-up a surprisingly simple solution.

title: Why Ramaswamy’s Team Is Hopeful His 9/11 Scandal Is Behind Him and Why It May Not Be
description: Ramaswamy's team believes he has weathered the controversy in stride. Critics aren't so sure.

title: To Leap-Frog Fossil Fuels, Africa Needs More Clean Energy Investment
description: Africa saw just 2% of global clean energy investment this year, despite the continent being home to one-fifth of humanity.

title: How to Start Foraging for Vegetables in the Sea
description: Most seaweed is edible, if you know where to look.

title: Ava DuVernay’s Origin Is a Sensitive Portrait of Writing and Grief
description: Aunjanue Ellis-Taylor sensitively plays 'Caste' author Isabel Wilkerson as she embarks on an ambitious project in the face of grief.

title: WATCH: Forgiving Johnny, a Short Documentary About the Power of Love and the Law
description: 'Forgiving Johnny' tells the story of one case that highlights the justice system "at its finest"

title: Moderna Says Its New COVID-19 Vaccine Protects Against the BA.2.86 Variant
description: The vaccine wasn’t designed to target this latest variant, but still prompts a strong immune response, the company reports.

title: Burned Out at Work? Find Someone to Split Your Job 50-50 With You
description: Some companies are allowing workers to split jobs 50-50 to recruit and retain women.

title: The Northern Hemisphere Just Lived Through Its Hottest Summer Ever Recorded
description: Scientists blame human-caused climate change from burning coal, oil, and natural gas with an extra push from a natural El Nino.

title: Inside Elon Musk’s Struggle for the Future of AI
description: 'I can't just sit around and do nothing.' An exclusive excerpt from Walter Isaacson's new Elon Musk biography

title: Aging Americans Face Bleak Futures Unless We Let New Immigrants Help
description: As Americans age, states across the country are struggling to fill jobs in the health and care sectors. New immigrants would help.

title: The G20 Summit Is an Opportunity for Modi and a Test of India’s Global Leadership
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is counting on the Sept. 9-10 gathering to bolster his country’s position as a global leader as well as burnish his own diplomatic credentials—but it won’t be easy.

title: The U.K. Says It Will Declare Russia’s Wagner Group a Banned Terrorist Organization
description: The government says it remains a threat to global security even after the death of Wagner leader Yevgeny Prigozhin.

title: Antony Blinken Makes Unannounced Kyiv Visit in Show of U.S. Support for Ukraine
description: The U.S. Secretary of State’s visit is expected to include the announcement of new military aid between $175 million to $200 million.

title: China Arrests 2 Construction Workers for Smashing a Shortcut Through the Great Wall
description: The area of the breach was a broken-down section far from the restored segments most Chinese and foreign tourists are familiar with.

title: Chinese Lawmakers Want to Ban Clothes That ‘Hurt Feelings’
description: The draft law highlights how Chinese leader Xi Jinping has clamped down on civil liberties in the nation of some 1.4 billion people over his decade in power.
